Description: Roughly fashioned iron axe-head: with thin, more elongated lugs, both of which were probably hooked at their ends originally. The middle section only of the butt is flanged. The blade is much corroded and in poor condition. It is severely pitted all over. The tip of one of the lugs is missing and the other is broken. Half the cutting edge is lost, and the other half is cracked and turned through wear. The remaining edge is very sharp.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (133)
Condition: incomplete - haft missing, damage to lugs and cutting-edge, corroded
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
